channel.title: 1. Uptime Test on Splunk Observability Cloud Workshops
channel.description: Recent content in 1. Uptime Test on Splunk Observability Cloud Workshops

item.title: 1 Creating a test
item.description: 1. Open Synthetics 2. Click the Add new test button on the right side of the screen 3. Select Uptime and HTTP test 4. Name your test with [yourname] and any other details you’d like to include, like geographic region. 5. Fill in the URL field. You can use one of your own, or one of ours like https://frontend-eu.splunko11y.com, https://frontend-us.splunko11y.com, or https://www.splunk.com. 6. You can “try now” to validate that the endpoint is accessible before saving the test.

item.title: 1.2 Understanding results
item.description: Click into a test summary view and play with the Performance KPIs chart filters to see how you can slice and dice your data. This is a good place to get started understanding trends in your data. Later we will see what custom charts look like, so that you can have a consistent view of what you care about most. Workshop Question How does the data look? Is it consistent across time and locations?
